threads.com:
/vm/ is a place to discuss all types of multiplayer games, whether on console, handheld, or PC, co-op or competitive, online or local.

Does this mean discussion of multiplayer games is banned on other video game boards? No! /vm/ is just a separate board specifically focused on multiplayer games where discussions about your favorite games can thrive.

Please familiarize yourself with the rules and remember to use the spoiler function where appropriate!

Please note that, like /v/, "Generals"—long-term, one-after-the-other, recurring threads about a specific game are not permitted on /vm/. Such threads belong on >>>/vg/

Multiplayer games includes (but is not limited to) Fighting games, First-person shooters, MMOs, Racing games, Sports games, Board & Card games, Party games, and any other genre of game that requires two or more players. Please post threads about single player games on an appropriate board.

Looking for players? Post a LFP thread. Advertising your game servers is allowed and encouraged! Just don't ask for money or spam the board.

Consider using Hamachi, ZeroTier One, or GameRanger for playing old-school LAN games.

threads.com:
Welcome to /VM/abinogi. Mabinogi is a fun, once popular little old school Korean MMO from 2004 based around Celtic mythology with many different features. Your character can age, rebirth, eat food and gain weight, play and custom make music, and so much more. You can be anything and do anything all at once with no downsides. From non combat related skills like cooking, tailoring, blacksmithing, trading goods in a commerce, carpentry, etc. to different styles of combat like melee, magic, ninja, archery, puppetry, etc. all on 1 character. Although graphics and gameplay is still a bit dated, even after 14 years the game is still rich in content such as fashion contests, cooking contest, jousting, playing in or viewing large concerts, training pets, and so on and continues to be Nexon's most generous game.

https://mabinogi.nexon.net/news/all

threads.name: Anonymous
threads.com:
This is the only conclusion I've been able to come to.

Being in a world with thousands of players seem fun at first but that only works when you’re a kid. Truth is it’s really boring. Meeting a good variety of NPCs is way more fun than meeting players that act the same way as in real life depressed emo wannabe. It’s funny how a lot of MMORPG players seek the role playing aspect through PC simulations of Tabletop RPGs that only display still images and do not realize that they could do the same in the 3D world they’re used to reside in… to a certain extent, which brings up my second point.

You have no impact on the world. Whether you like it or not I’m going to use pic related as an example because if you’re on this website you’ve seen it. Let’s say you have a world like the Aincrad where you need to defeat a floor boss to access the next area. Even if you just killed that boss, everybody still have to do the same. You somehow didn’t pave the way for other players. So you’re in the same world, but not really. Whatever you do do not matter and cannot reach others. The reason for that is obvious; most people wouldn’t be able to play the game. Ironically, somewhat large scale co-op games are better than MMORPGs if you want to experience a virtual world with other people because they allow less restrictions on that matter.

When it comes to gameplay, I wonder why so many people start drooling whenever they see the number of players allowed in raids increase although 40 players raids like in Ashes of Creation feels nothing like cooperating. At this point you’re literally a needle in a haystack, it doesn’t feel like you’re fighting anything, you don’t need to pay attention to the game at all. You’re only here to meet the number requirements of some purely stats-based fake difficulty.

>>753369
TFC mod TL;DR, Start off as a caveman, end up at medieval tier technology, absolute fucktons of new content. This mod inspired the creator of the game Vintage Story, if you've heard of it

Basically you start off like a caveman, working with stone tools before working your way up to metal ones. Making your first pickaxe (which can only be made out of metal for balancing/progression purposes) is a big deal. It also adds over 20 new passive, neutral, & hostile mobs (which replace the zombies, skeletons, and other fictional enemies), over 20 new types of trees, crops & seeds, stone, dirt & grass, well over 50 new types of plants & flowers, new types of weapons like javelins, a thirst system, completely overhauled terrain generation, and a lot of other stuff to add more variety & a greater degree of realism to the game
It also adds over a dozen new systems. To briefly go over just one of them, the ambient temperature system: it doesn't directly affect players through health loss or anything, but it does affect where crops can/can't be planted, suddenly makes crops destroy themselves if the area is too hot or too cold for too long, and different crops can withstand different temperature ranges. It also governs where saplings can/can't be planted, etc.
Most other new systems are similarly complex, such as an overhauled smithing system for crafting things like tool heads & weapon blades, a nutrient system that affects crop growth & the player's max health, and more

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>753863
Coalesced Coinage is not bad for radiant CHA casters for its level. The helmets from Memory Lapse can be good but Feywild helmets, especially Crown of Butterflies are ridiculously busted for their level. The rest of the gear is okay, its generally new stuff so it isn't terrible like most old loot but it's nowhere near the best you can get. White Plume Mountain, despite being from the same pack, has some pretty nice stuff as well. (Blackrazor, Celestial Beacon, Deathward Clicky, Black Opal, Precision Lenses in particular are generally pretty great). Barovian weapons are literally given out for free if you have Ravenloft and do the first quest and they are one of the best options for 10+ in terms of weapons. I'd also pay attention to loot from the Demon Sands pack, a lot of the stuff got updated and they are extremely strong (Golden Greaves and Ring of Baphomet pretty much make you immortal in heroics against melees, Whirlwind has a ridiculous crit range, and there are quite a few caster set bonuses if you need to squeeze out spell crit).
Expansions generally are the best gear to farm out and they cover a pretty good level range (Feywild from 5 to 10, Ravenloft from 10 to 15, Sharn from 15 to 20). I'd generally stick to a set of named gear from those expansions and weight whether swapping out expansion gearsets for something else is worthwhile for the slot.

Blocker's goal is to delay any inevitable attacks for as long as possible by denying area and stalling with heals, buffs, or status effects.

threads.name: /bng/ - BallisticNG Saturday races
threads.com:
>What is this game?
BallisticNG is a PC anti-gravity racing game available on Steam for $8, based mostly on Wip3out, with optional mechanics from the newer Wipeout games.
If you like going fast, good tunes, and good fun, this game is for you.

>How do I join?
Get the game (Grab the Outer Reaches DLC for $3 if you want, though not required as we mostly play custom tracks anyway).
Download and install the track pack (instructions in the pastebin).
Launch the game, go to Multiplayer, and join what is most likely the only public Steam lobby online. If we are playing in an IP lobby (piratefag friendly) it will be designated at the end of this post or within the thread.

Everything else you need will be here:
https://pastebin.com/tHrNfZdv
Make sure you get the Trackpack
Newest Trackpack (last updated: 2022/09/22):
https://mega.nz/file/m4gHVJQJ#_ay4DAvFLsQ4hlHzDrsZp_9uGjyyVQucGb4HSSdTA_I
Newest Minipack, get this if you're just updating your track pack:
https://mega.nz/file/el4jFCzT#-0lH7G1ENVLM-9lfUE4a11DAwksbw2xPEvzhDfWd6yo
See pastebin for instructions on how to install or update your pack without causing the game to fail to recognize which tracks you have installed.

>How do I play?
Anon guide will be posted, there's 3 parts covering most basics.
Try to practice airbraking and things for a little bit using the Campaign's practice mode before jumping right in otherwise you'll probably have a hard time.
We can also answer any questions you might have, either here or within the lobby.

>I'm bad and not going to win!
Once you get above the skill floor anyone can win races due to their chaotic nature.
Also we always get newfriends who will match your skill level.

We also have a steam group: https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ballisticnv
This is used just for organizing race sessions, no circlejerking.

last_replies.com:
>>753937
-Races are purely cosmetic, paying to unlock is totally by choice. I believe certain classes were race locked though so also depends what class you want to play. There are a few one off dialogue options such as Chiss operative.
-Biggest thing I can remember with premium account is not having a money cap. The one nice thing was that any excess money you earned was 'stored' and accessible any time you decided to sub; if sub expired you went back to cap and excess was stored again.
-Cash shop is a lot of cosmetics
-Typical single player with some group content. Has always been lacking in 'end game'

I played when it first launched leaving WoW for the hype. Initially game was great but they had a million servers with spread thin populations and no end game. This led to f2p/p2w crap show. Initially f2p had stupid limitations like limited action bars and limited access to 'dungeons'.
Played a couple years ago and was much better f2p experience but by far best experience playing the game was playing through all the 1-50 class stories for both republic and empire. Expansions were meh at best, not sure about current content. Pvp was entertaining. Still probably my favorite mmo combat play.

>More of a general observation. I got a trader ship, and tried doing transport missions. Got one to tell me to go to the next island over, and immediately got ganked by 3 Russians.
Wait, I remember that. We were chasing those three. They were in Rattlesnakes, weren't they?
>Which is whatever, that kinda stuff pretty much always happens in these games. But the overworld does a very poor job of telling you really anything. There's no way to see pirate activity beyond constantly checking the combat tab, NPCs sail around but don't really seem to do anything, never report sightings, or anything like that.
Yeah, it's to keep things fair. If NPCs constantly reported player activity, it'd be too much.
>The game itself doesn't even warn you that you're taking a mission that's pretty likely to take you into ganking territory either.
All territory is ganking territory. Play safely. Ask in Nation chat which areas you should start out in, and start making a map of locations where people of your faction are getting sunk.

Gotcha.
>But, overall, I just feel that pointing your ship in the direction of a port you want to go to and then just waiting for 20 minutes isn't very engaging.
It isn't. Charting your route, predicting the wind and your travel time, making a list of stations, arranging data to outmaneuver your enemies, and trading/privateering in enemy lands? Much better. Keeps you on your toes, and engages you in a way most games can't.

>>How to connect
From wii.guide/wiimmfi:
>Wii (no homebrew)
1. Insert your game disc.
2. Go into your internet connection settings and set the DNS server of your console to 95.217.77.151.
3. Go to the WC24 contract information (third button after clicking on “Internet” in the settings).
4. Confirm that you do want to use WC24 and the shop channel
5. The Wiimmfi patcher page should show up. If it doesn’t, and you still see the default license agreement, your router might not be compatible with this method.
6. Wait for about 1 minute and 30 seconds for the patcher to load
The game should now start with the Wiimmfi patch included
>Nintendo DS
You'll need a Wi-Fi network with WEP or no security
1. Go in the Nintendo DS Wi-Fi settings. This can be accessed inside the game you want to play online with.
2. Set up a connection.
3. Type in 164.132.44.106 as the primary DNS.
4. Type in 1.1.1.1 as the secondary DNS (if it gives you problems, try 8.8.8.8).
5. Save your connection settings and perform a connection test. If it’s successful, then you’re ready to play.
>Supported games

Do you play an MMORPG (or private server) that is generally too small to level with other people either because everyone else is at level cap, group leveling is considered outdated, or because there is just not enough people to form groups for group content? Is there an MMORPG or private server that you would play if there were people to level with? Or maybe you're looking for a new MMORPG (or private server) to play with some people.

This is not a thread to find people to play popular MMORPGs with (Guild Wars 2, World of Warcraft or its more popular private servers, New World, Lost Ark, FFXIV, CoH Homecoming, Return of Reckoning, etc). This is for the dead, dying, or just very small MMORPGs (or at least the ones in which it is a struggle or impossible to find people for group content while leveling) such as EverQuest I and II, LotRO, DDO, Asheron's Call, Age of Conan, and small private servers. As ultimately I do not know which ones exactly are hard to find groups for, this is up to your discretion and is ultimately a thread guideline.

Only advertise here if you are serious about helping form a leveling group or even a community (such as a guild) on your game. Coordinate with people on times (if a group) or simply a server and faction/realm (if a guild/community).

threads.sub: The death of friendship in gaming
threads.com:
the death of friendship in gaming has coincided with the death of private servers in gaming
since everything now became 1 service you are either conformed to that service or you don't get to play the game
beyond cheating, if you hold the "wrong" views, say bad words or are disliked by the parent organization you get banned through automation in which reinstatement becomes difficult or in some cases impractiacal or impossible to persuit.
because this harms profit no resources are ever put into this, only the absoulute bare minimum.
on private servers if you get banned for conduct, nearly every private server was ran by a community and you could appeal to that community and it would be handled in a civil matter between people.
this process is impossible in modern games because private servers have been phased out completely
the community aspect of banns is only 1 portion, but in order to have a place worth keeping clean it requires a community to be built. and thus it makes circumstances of people who play together for friendship on common interests / geography(ping) and so forth.
the benefit of playing on a private server is your activity MADE YOU PART OF THE COMMUNITY and you were recognized and made friends along the way, and it was a process where you would apply to be formally recognzed, including tags that represented that you were part of the clan. The server wanted to facilitate this because they could leverage it for donations to keep the servers running and it was a great thing to go by on. often most servers weren't "profitable" but still you would find a way.
now all you do is load up your game, you click "find match" and you get thrown into some kind of cesspool that you have no control over. there are no admins you can contact if you have problems to the average user, there are no forums that are taken as a serious representaiton of the community. these modern gaming services are so anti-social that there's no wonder why streaming became so popular

threads.com:
Welcome to /VM/abinogi. Mabinogi is a fun, once popular little old school Korean MMO from 2004 based around Celtic mythology with many different features. Your character can age, rebirth, eat food and gain weight, play and custom make music, and so much more. You can be anything and do anything all at once with no downsides. From non combat related skills like cooking, tailoring, blacksmithing, trading goods in a commerce, carpentry, etc. to different styles of combat like melee, magic, ninja, archery, puppetry, etc. all on 1 character. Although graphics and gameplay is still a bit dated, even after 14 years the game is still rich in content such as fashion contests, cooking contest, jousting, playing in or viewing large concerts, training pets, and so on and continues to be Nexon's most generous game.

>News and Events
https://mabinogi.nexon.net/news/all

>Many combat talents, life talents, commerce system, field bosses have been revamped
